intro: Rhynchospora millegrana, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in the Americas. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, linear leaves and produces spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, contributing to the ecological stability of wetland ecosystems. Rhynchospora millegrana is often found in regions with temperate climates and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
